lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Represents a command to find tasks matching a specific keyword.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the given full command.
* Executes the FindCommand using the provided task list, user interface, and storage.
* Print tasks matching the provided keyword.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler for data persistence.
* @throws Exception Any exceptions that may occur during command execution.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws Exception {
* Represents the main class for the chat bot.
* Encapsulates the logic of the chat bot's functionality.
* Constructs a Duke instance with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The file path for data storage.
* Runs the chat bot by displaying a welcome message
while (!isExit && ui.checkForCommand()) { // need to check whether scanner has a next line
* Main method to start the chat bot.
* Represents a command to add tasks to the task list.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the specified command and date-time formatter.
* @param formatter   The date-time formatter to parse date and time inputs.
* Executes the add command, adding the appropriate task to the task list.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler to manage data persistence.
* @throws NoDescriptionException   If the task description is missing.
* @throws UnknownTimeException     If the task time is not recognized.
* @throws BackwardsTimeException   If an event's end time is before its start time.
* @throws UnknownCommandException  If the command is not recognized.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NoDescriptionException,
* Represents a command to check tasks scheduled on a specific date and time.
* Constructs a CheckCommand with the specified command and date-time formatter.
* @param formatter   The date-time formatter to parse date and time inputs.
* Executes the check command, displaying tasks scheduled on the specified date and time.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command that can be executed on the task list.
* Constructs a command with the given full command string.
* Constructs a command with no command string.
* Executes the command using the provided task list, user interface, and storage.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler for data persistence.
* @throws Exception Any exceptions that may occur during command execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws Exception;
* Checks if the command is an exit command to determine whether bot should end.
* @return True if the command is an exit command, otherwise false.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the given full command string.
* Executes the delete command, removing a task from the task list.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler (not used in this command).
* @throws NoIndexException If the provided index is invalid or missing.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NoIndexException {
* Represents a command to exit the chatbot.
* Executes the exit command, indicating that the chatbot should end.
* Also saves tasks to storage and displays the outro message.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler for data persistence.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to list tasks from the task list.
* Executes the list command, displaying the tasks in the task list.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @throws EmptyTaskListException If the task list is empty.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws EmptyTaskListException {
* Represents a command to mark a task as done.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the given full command string.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler (not used in this command).
* @throws NoIndexException If the provided index is invalid or missing.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NoIndexException {
* Represents a command to unmark a task as done.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the given full command string.
* Marks a task as not done.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler (not used in this command).
* @throws NoIndexException If the provided index is invalid or missing.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws NoIndexException {
* Represents an exception that is thrown when the provided timeframe is impossible
* as the deadline is earlier than the start for an event task.
* Constructs a BackwardsTimeException with a default error message.
super("Sorry... The provided timeframe is impossible as the deadline is earlier than the start...");
* Represents an exception that is thrown when the task list is empty.
* Constructs an EmptyTaskListException with a default error message.
super(" OOPS!!! The task list cannot be empty.");
* Represents an exception that is thrown when a command requires a description,
* but no description is provided by the user.
* Constructs a NoDescriptionException with a formatted error message.
* @param message The specific command that requires a description.
super(String.format(" OOPS!!! Where is your description for %s?", message));
* Represents an exception that is thrown when an invalid or nonexistent index is used.
* Constructs a NoIndexException with a formatted error message.
* @param message The index value that caused the exception.
super(String.format(" OOPS!!! The index %s does not exist.", message));
* Represents an exception that is thrown when an unknown command is encountered.
* Constructs an UnknownCommandException with a formatted error message.
* @param message The unknown command that caused the exception.
super(String.format(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what %s means :-(", message));
* Represents an exception that is thrown when an unknown time format is encountered.
* Constructs an UnknownTimeException with a formatted error message.
* @param message The task description for which the time is unknown.
super(String.format(" OOPS!!! Sorry but what is that time? %s is missing it", message));
* Represents an exception that is thrown when the storage file has an unrecognized format.
* Constructs an UnrecognisedFormatException with a default error message.
super("Sorry!!! This data file is corrupted and we do not recognise the format of the file.");
* Represents a deadline task in the chat bot.
* Deadlines are tasks that need to be done before a specific date/time.
* Constructs a deadline task with the given description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param deadline    The deadline of the task.
* Constructs a deadline task with the given description, deadline, and done status.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param deadline    The deadline of the task.
* @param isDone      The done status of the task.
public Deadline(String description, LocalDateTime deadline, boolean isDone) {

* @return True if the deadline task is within the date range, false otherwise.
* Represents an event task in the chat bot.
* Event tasks start at a specific date/time and end at a specific date/time.

* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param start       The start date/time of the event.
* @param deadline    The end date/time of the event.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime deadline) {

* @param start       The start date/time of the event.
* @param deadline    The end date/time of the event.
* @param isDone      The done status of the task.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime deadline, boolean isDone) {

* Formats the event task for storage in a data file.

* @return True if the event task is within the date range, false otherwise.

* Constructs a task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Constructs a task with the given description and done status.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param isDone      The done status of the task.
* Gets the status icon of the task.
* @return The string representation of the status icon.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* @return The string representation of the task.
* Formats the task for storage in a data file.
* Checks if the task is within the given date range.

* @return True if the task is within the date range, false otherwise.
* Checks if the task's description contains the given keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for.
* @return True if the description contains the keyword, false otherwise.
* Encapsulates a Todo in the chat bot.
* Handles the parsing of user commands and making sense of the user command.
* Represents the different commands accepted by the chatbot.
BYE, LIST, MARK, UNMARK, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE, CHECK, FIND
